baseline_groups.claim_summary: Political party turnover at close elections reduces 4th-grade test scores in municipal schools.
baseline_groups.notes: Coefficient -0.042 (p=0.10). RD design with incumbent vote margin as running variable. Bandwidth 0.09.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Political turnover increases teacher turnover (new teacher share).
baseline_groups.notes: Coefficient 0.128 (p<0.001). Highly robust across all specifications.

global_notes: Paper studies effects of political party turnover in Brazilian municipal elections on education via an RD design. Bureaucratic turnover (teacher/headmaster replacement) is highly robust; test score effects are consistently negative but often marginally significant. Multiple outcomes tested across bandwidth variations.
